content: This contribution hasn’t received enough positive votes from the community. The "FASTEST" option has therefore been deactivated.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Looks like a good challenge, nice work.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good challenge. Seems appropriate for CoC.

Seems like it'd be a decent CoC challenge, although one thing you might want to consider:

My initial solution converted to a binary (string) and would have hit array indexing errors if there was any need to left-pad the binary representation with zeros (there was no need in the existing tests). This is fine so long as any validation post-submit validation tests are similarly lenient about not requiring any left-padding to pass

An example test that would have hit an error with my first go at it is below, which I think matches your description of an "ASCII printable character". I'd suggest either stating that it's a letter of the alphabet (no need to worry that there's less than 7 bits as A=65=b1000001)

n=129068
false
6
1
?

:)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Weird flex, but ok in general.

I like... 
That's an idea of CoC that i had

But i did not publish it because i would have put an unsigned int and i did  not want to fight (or maybe i did) with those who think that "-7" is "-0b111" in binary :D
